com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.typecontainers

Class UserConfigurationType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.typecontainers.UserConfigurationType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationType, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InstantiableUserConfigurationType, MotorConfigurationType

    public abstract class UserConfigurationType
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConfigurationType, java.io.Serializable
    UserConfigurationType contains metadata regarding classes which have been declared as user-defined sensor implementations. Subclasses should be either abstract or final.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getDeviceFlavor

        public ConfigurationType.DeviceFlavor getDeviceFlavor()
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationType
        Returns the configuration type's most specific flavor. Types defined in BuiltInConfigurationType will only return DeviceFlavor.BUILT_IN if none of the other types apply. If you need to know if this type is defined in the BuiltInConfigurationType enum, use isDeviceFlavor(BUILT_IN). For BuiltInConfigurationType instances that are defined both as a legacy device and as a modern device, this will assume you're asking about the modern variant.
        Specified by:
        getDeviceFlavor in interface ConfigurationType

      • toUSBDeviceType

        public DeviceManager.UsbDeviceType toUSBDeviceType()
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationType
        If this configuration type has a corresponding USB device configuration type, returns same; otherwise, returns FTDI_USB_UNKNOWN_DEVICE.
        Specified by:
